item.title: network3d - a 3D network visualization and layout library
item.description: What is network3d? network3d is a tiny R package built using the htmlwidgets package that takes network data in the form of a node and edge dataframes and performs a physics simulation to determine the optimal layout in three dimensions. There is a lot of customization you can do but attempts have been made to make it as simple to use as possible.

item.title: MCMC and the case of the spilled seeds
item.description: Earlier this month I did a post on simulated annealing, an algorithm that I learned in the class I‚Äôm currently taking: Advanced Statistical Computing taught by Chris Fonnesbeck here at Vanderbilt. Recently we have moved on to more traditionally ‚Äústatistics‚Äù algorithms, and one that Dr.¬†Fonnesbeck is particularly well versed in, Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo (or MCMC). ‚äïDr.¬†Fonnesbeck is the creator of the very popular python library pymc.
